name: AzureFunctionOnKubernetes
description: Deploy Azure function to Kubernetes cluster.
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://aka.ms/func-k8s) or [see Azure Functions on Kubernetes with KEDA](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-kubernetes-keda) or [check out sample-hello-world-azure-functions](https://github.com/kedacore/sample-hello-world-azure-functions)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: dockerRegistryServiceConnection
inputs.label: Docker registry service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection.

inputs.name: secretName
inputs.label: Secret Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Kubernetes secret containing function config data (for ex. AzureWebJobsStorage: <Azure storage connection string>)

inputs.name: dockerHubNamespace
inputs.label: Docker Hub namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Docker Hub namespace. Required for private Docker Hub repository.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Application Name. The Kubernetes objects created use this name. This should follow Kubernetes naming conventions for resource names.

inputs.name: functionRootDirectory
inputs.label: Function root directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Function root directory. Should contain host.json. Docker build and push is performed from this directory.

inputs.name: waitForStability
inputs.label: Wait for stability
inputs.helpMarkDown: Wait for the Kubernetes objects to reach the desired state.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Pass arguments to command. Ex:
--no-docker --service-type NodePort

messages.AllContainersNotInReadyState: All the containers are not in a ready state.
messages.CouldNotDeterminePodStatus: Could not determine the pod's status due to the error: %s
messages.CouldNotDetermineServiceStatus: Could not determine the service %s status due to the error: %s
messages.FileContentSynced: Synced the file content to the disk. The content is %s.
messages.NoDataWrittenOnFile: No data was written into the file %s
messages.WritingDockerConfigToTempFile: Writing Docker config to temp file. File path: %s, Docker config: %s
